info.title: OPERA Cloud Block Configuration API
info.description:
APIs for Block configuration, such as creating, updating, fetching and removing codes related to blocks.
< This might include fetching the block cancellation reasons, or creating new block refused reasons. Wash schedules can be create, or new reservation methods could be added for a property.

Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 22.3.

blockStatusCodes.description: Collection of configured Block Status Codes.

status.description: Code and Description used to define a status e.g. (INT, TENT, DEF, CXL) (initial, tentative, definite, cancelled).

roomStatusType.description: Room status type selected for status code.

cateringStatusType.description: Catering status type selected for status code. When the OPS Sales & Catering license code is active, the Sales & Catering status type for the status code is displayed.

defaultReservationType.description: Default reservation type to be used for the status code. The reservation type and status code must have the same deduct/no deduct status.

reasonType.description: Reason type for every block reservation cancellation. Block Cancellation Reason, Block Refused Reasons, and Block Lost Reasons.

color.description: Color code for the status code.

allowPickup.description: Indicates if the rooms with this status code will be allowed for pickup or not.

returnToInventory.description: Indicates if the rooms with this status code can be returned to availability or not.

starting.description: Indicates if the status code is the starting status of the status cycle or not.

leadStatus.description: Indicates the default status for all new leads. Only one lead status can be selected as the default.

logCatering.description: Indicates if the status code logs the catering changes or not.

showDiary.description: Indicates if the function diary will be shown within the Sales and Catering.

orderBy.description: Indicates the order the status code is displayed in the status cycle.

inUse.description: Returns true if the status code is already used in Block / Event / Status Flow.

cateringInUse.description: Returns true if the status code is already used in Events.

opportunity.description: Indicates that the business block created with this Status is an Opportunity.

codeDescriptionType.description: This contains a generic code and description information.

blockStatusCodeStatusType.description: Simple type for block status code's room status type and catering status type. Valid status values are Waitlist,Cancel,Lost,Refused,Actual,Inquiry,NonDeductInv,DeductInv and Referral.
